txt.en: 'Good work!'
'See, Golodir. It is as I promised. Here is your daughter.'
'And here is [placeholder] and all the others you have watched for so long.'
'You see, for a great many days, Golodir has watched you from afar through a palantír.'
'I told him that seeing your failures would break his will.'
'Now we fight!'
'Yet, as he saw your \qsuccesses,\q he thought me the fool.'
'Now though, as he sees your final defeat at my hands, he shall know true despair!'

Golodir speaks through choking sobs, 'No, no... Lorniel!

'He was right... Mordirith was right. He was just playing with me... with you. He could have defeated you today if he had truly wanted to.

'All that time seeing through the palantír I thought I would see the victory... that Lorniel and you... that you would free me, would bring about the downfall of Angmar. It is all gone... all is lost....'
'Quickly, we must leave this terrible place....'
'Father! Are you badly hurt?'
'And in his despair, he shall abandon all hope and become a servant of the Iron Crown!'

'Good, so far we have passed unnoticed by the Enemy. Now we must see if we can find my father.

'I have no insight into where exactly he may be... Raghnall did not tell me where in Rhunendin he would be found. We will have to make a careful search.

'Prepare yourself, who knows what lies ahead....'
'Look at all of them! Quick, this way!'
'It is very strange that the key did not work on this gate. I hope we do not encounter any other unexpected surprises as we continue on.'
'My father is not here. How could Raghnall's words have proven false? I fear that we will have to go into Carn Dûm itself!'
Lorniel has been defeated
'It is enough! I need not waste time with you fools any longer!'
Lorniel has been defeated
Lorniel has been defeated
Defeated Mordirith, the False King
'Summon the giant!'
You have travelled to Rhunendin with Lorniel. Using the key you helped forge, she is going to search for her father.
'Intruders!'
'Bring forth the giant! They must be stopped!'
Talk to Golodir
'Strange... the key does not work here....'
'Stop them! They cannot interrupt the ritual!'
'I am not sure why the key did not work, but I did see a means to open the gate.'
'Perhaps the key will work here....'
'On the other side of the gate, there is a lever.'
'I will wait here and watch the pass behind us.'
'Leave now and take Golodir with you.'
'I have accomplished what I set out to do!'
Talk to Lorniel
'Let us hold here for a moment. Perhaps an opportunity will present itself....'
Protect Lorniel as she searches for her father
Open the gate for Lorniel
'It is not him. Let us continue!'
'This poor soul is not my father....'
Talk to Lorniel
'I am sure now; this is not my father.'
Protect Lorniel as she searches for her father
Talk to Lorniel
'Never!'
'Lorniel!'
Protect Lorniel as she searches for her father
Defeat Mordirith, the False King
Defeat Mordirith, the False King
'The giant has broken free from our will!'
'It is time to put this key to its final test....'
'Tread carefully now....'
'Wait! The gates open on their own!'
'Father!'
Protect Lorniel as she searches for her father, Golodir.

Use the lever on the other side of the gate.\n\nAs you progressed deeper into Rhunendin, you encountered a gate the key to Carn Dûm would not open. You should make your way to the lever and open the gate for Lorniel.
Protect Lorniel as she searches for her father, Golodir.
Protect Lorniel as she searches for her father, Golodir.
After you found Golodir, Lorniel was slain. Now the False King stands before you, far from his source of power. Now is the time to defeat Mordirith.
'Be on your guard....'
Golodir is waiting to talk to you.\n\nYou have found Golodir and driven off Mordirith, but at a terrible cost.
'There, a fallen Ranger!'
'Another Ranger lies ahead!'
'I can see another fallen Ranger ahead.'
'There! Another Ranger!'
'Good!'
'Die.'
'Hurry now, use the lever on the other side of the gate and open the way.'
'Please do not be him....'
'Hold, I will open this gate....'
'Please do not let this be my father!'
'Father, is that you?'
'Come now, Carn Dûm lies before us!'
'Wait... this is Raghnall!'
Instance: The Gates of Carn Dûm
'He is not here!'
